I took lyrics from multiple Loveshadow songs and recombined them with new melodies to fit his instrumental Leviathan - edited just to fit the song format that emerged. (intro from Marco's Theme)

Mixed on headphones whilst still on bedrest, hopefully the levels are reasonable (feedback welcome).

VJ_Memes.review: Smooth, toe tappin', head boppin, acid-jazz, funky lounge style. This Siobhan Dakay remix of J.Lang grooves...hard!

upload_description_plain:
Yeah, for you only for you....
Really it took only two stems from DJLang to make this track. 
"Don't you think that I" a track that has such a driving beat. I only wave shaped, remastered this. 

Found the vocals from Jazz Singer Lamone that DJLang uploaded and did quiet some extended work with them. 

Given that J appears to have some affinity to Jazz I glued flutes and a muted horn into the mix. 

I hope you like it J.

texasradiofish.review: Scomber and Snowflake deliver a powerful vocal duet in this heartfelt rock ballad [i]Wait here for you[/i]. Stefan Kartenberg lays down a solid song foundation with a stellar guitar accompaniment.

upload_description_plain:
I was really pleased to see this secret mixter's theme of "come together" because this is what ccMixter is really all about and I'm sure we all really need this now. 
No matter where you are in the world, ccMixter allows us to share something intimate with a person you have never met thousands of miles away and get a great insight into another artist's inner creative world.

Although I've met up with some ccmixter artists across the world over the years, I've never met Snowflake in person -   yet I  feel that I know her very well through her music and the honesty of her lyrics.
So what better way to come together than through a duet!!

Drawing Emily this time around was another opportunity for me to cover one of her songs as a virtual duet and discover more about her craft and lyrics.

Over the past 12 1/2 years I've been on ccmixter this is the fourth virtual duet Ive been honoured to sing with Snowflake. 

Here's the other three;

2019 "Its up to you" 

2017 "Open"

2011 "Much too Young"

For this song, instead of  going to go down the regular piano and two voices route I was lucky to fall over Stefan's great guitar rock ballad version with stems :)

Many thanks to Snowflake for such a beautiful song,  and Stef mate, your guitar sensibility is outstanding. 

I hope you both enjoy this version.

Scomber x 2020

Down With Ben and Airtone team up to deliver that classic American folks song, [i]Shenandoah[/i]. Always a pleasure hearing a classic folk music performance that projects emotion. 

"Away, we‚Äôre bound away, 
Across the wide Missouri."

As soon as I started listening to it, Shenandoah came to mind. I‚Äôve always had a soft spot for that classic American folk song, so I was delighted that it seemed to fit so well with airtone‚Äôs track. 

But I suppose that‚Äôs the great thing about the pliable Pachelbel progression - easily repurposed and plays with practically everything.  üòÅ

upload_description_plain:
7OOP3D is such an incredibly talented duo. I really lucked out drawing them for this Secret Mixter for a very specific reason... their music often visits the darkness. And whooo... that's where I've been. (My dad died from COVID-19 on December 3rd.) 

After I found this instrumental by 7OOP3D and stripped it down to the orchestral elements, I was left with the perfect backing track to process my sadness. And you know what? By the time I was done mixing, I felt lighter. 

So thank you to 7OOP3D for providing the space for me to feel some things that needed felt and released. Music is cathartic.

Every note of music in this track is by 7OOP3D. I added vocals and field recordings of crows and rain. The crows visit my neighborhood en masse each year. Hundreds of them were in the trees, on the street, and in the yards. It's magical to watch these intelligent, inquisitive birds.

Here are the vocal stems.

WORDS

These severed roots
Leave a broken heart
To make sense of this world
With a haunted mind

Alone
Confused
Shivering
Deteriorating
Swirling in a morphine dream world
Still connected to a body that is
Unable to breathe a full breath
Still connected to a physical form
Starving and shutting down

I cannot reconcile my sadness
Tears for one and a half million deceased
Whose bodies became the casualty
Of our collective failure
To prepare
To believe
To sacrifice 
To lead

And this anger, searing rage
This nightmare tugs at my sleeve
Remembering a heart
As it beat arrhythmically
Quivering uselessly
Unable to pump the blood 
Her body needs
Left as a memory
Fading in the minds
Most can only mourn
For a little bit of time

Severed roots
Haunted mind
Could have
Should have
Didn‚Äôt have time
Severed roots
Haunted mind
Could have
Should have
Didn‚Äôt have time 

These severed roots
Leave a broken
To make sense of this world
With a haunted mind

upload_description_plain:
The leaving of the angel

We found them in places that would always remain special.  They were bright and beautiful and their radiance fell over us.  We were smitten and foolish swearing life long allegiance and offering promises of eternal love.

But then one day we woke and looked at the tattered wings and the heavy skin and we were confused.  The- light had gone and we ached to follow others who would offer us the magic potion.

Once they were angels but we crushed them with our ingratitude and believing in our own rightousness moved on to others who were now the only light we craved.

Once we would come together to be one but now we were just victims of our sad inhumanity.


Panu's music comes from a place  deep within the soul and climbs through the musical ages in a style of its own.   I love the guitars but most of all it's the voice that stirs me. The phrasing the intonation and of course the words themselves.  I have taken his gift and laid it on a bed of angels for all the angels who bravely stay with us as we march towards the light

Once they were angels but we crushed them with our ingratitude and believing in our own rightousness moved on to others who were now the only light we craved.

Panu’s music comes from a place deep within the soul and climbs through the musical ages in a style of its own. I love the guitars but most of all it’s the voice that stirs me. Martin Cee is one of the most uniquely original voices in Mixterland.  His poetry and story telling would be right at home on a BBC radio special and his original music would fit perfectly on the soundtrack of the next Coen brothers' film.

Enjoy!

upload_description_plain:
What better way is there of coming together than two people meeting for the first time, and falling in love...

A real challenge, to be sure... Scomber has a huge and lovely catalogue of acapellas, and picking just one was a mind blowing experience. After many hours of listening and thinking, I finally whittled my choices down to just one, a much harder decision than I thought!

I had in mind to try a first for me, a ballad. So, when my pick was finally decided upon, I went to work. I hope the result is as enjoyable for you as it was for me to create.

Stems included
Key: A
BPM: 100

upload_description_plain: I thought I had a mix sorted this morning.  Then all these guitar tracks appeared and the whole thing changed direction.
upload_description_html: I thought I had a mix sorted this morning.  Then all these guitar tracks appeared and the whole thing changed direction.

howididit.origial: I used simply the samples by Radioontheshelf
howididit.process: I took each of five samples and used pitch changes, delay, reverse and tempo changes to vary the sound from the original while retaining the recognizable originals' sound.

upload_description_plain:
I am blessed with the gift of happy holiday memories, but also with the sense of longing as to people who are no longer with us, as well as the places and times that also faded away.
This piece seeks to capture a bit of that joy and of that longing.

Given the rich set of pieces by  Radioontheshelf, I aimed to create something that kept a high fidelity to the original set of samples, but still did some different things with them.

upload_name: it was dry, then it rained ....
upload_description_plain:
Hello mixter people! 

Well this times mixter brought me to Siobhan Dakay 

When i saw this in the email it was "gulp!" as SD is an extremely accomplished musician and i can barely hold a note :)

But thats one of things secret mixter does ... makes you take on new challenges! 

So here is "it was dry, then it rained"

Held together by two short poems by Debbizo - which are fab 

Unusually for me i have actually made an attempt at addressing the theme of the mixter 

It has been dry ... the last four years horrible politics and then the virus  

It rained ... sense of relief after the US elections and the vaccines now coming available 

.... we move forward together to a hopeful future that will still have i fear, some discordant notes 

Siobhan i hope you like it :)

Enjoy!

upload_name: Breakfast on the Dark Side of the Moon
upload_description_plain:
The dining room was empty as Max strolled in from the hallway. He glanced around and went to a table by the huge windows.
He took a seat and then his fingers danced on the table, as a keyboard as he placed his hands on the table.
Within seconds his breakfast appeared out of thin air, like a cheap magician's trick. He picked up the coffee and took a sip while staring out the window at the Earth that seemed to hover upon the horizon....
upload_description_html:
The dining room was empty as Max strolled in from the hallway. He glanced around and went to a table by the huge windows.
He took a seat and then his fingers danced on the table, as a keyboard as he placed his hands on the table.
Within seconds his breakfast appeared out of thin air, like a cheap magician’s trick. He picked up the coffee and took a sip while staring out the window at the Earth that seemed to hover upon the horizon….

upload_description_plain:
Mix Two of Bangcorrupt was something of an accident.

People, children, adults go missing from our lives for all sorts of reasons, physically or emotionally. 2020 has created a world united in real loss or the potential of it . Whether you are a sceptic or believer of the crisis the world still faces, or get high on the politics of it all, there are the relations of over 1.6 million people who still leave a light on somewhere, whether it's in a window or in the heart. And that's just this one virus, so there are more.

This little story played out in my head for a myriad of reasons, reminding me that the innocence of youth will continue to make their mistakes, at the cost of those close to them. It's not a regret or the want to change, it just is the way it is.  

Light In a Window

Down in a town in Mexico
Ten miles from the border
A young senorita waits 
She thinks of her lover
Across the town a young Jose
He puts a light in his window
They'll be gone before the day breaks
They're heading for El Paso 

They're never going home  , They're never going home, They're just a Light in a window
They're Never going home 

They're heading North the sun is up 
It burns down like a demon
He holds her hand tight, he leads the way
She can't describe what she's feeling
She looks so deeply into his eyes 
All she sees is their future 
Because she's finally a woman 
He's finally a man 

Chorus, Break, Chorus 

They cut across the countryside
Down to the River 
Midday they're going meet their guide
They're praying he'll deliver
They see him, but they never see
The gun that he's hiding 
Two shots they hit the ground
Now no ones ever going to find them

Chorus, break 

Down in a town in Mexico
Ten miles from the border
A mother cries  she sits and waits
She thinks of her daughter
Across the town, not so far away
His father lights a candle
Tries not to cry but his heart breaks
Cause deep inside he truly knows

They're never coming home 
They're never coming home 
Another light in a window 
They're never coming home 

LS 2020

upload_name: Music Through Love ft. Kara Square
upload_description_plain:
Kara teaches us that love and respect are two-way streets, and that there is a way to get through gridlock with music.

When I think of Kara's music, I cannot imagine it without the ukelele. Her voice with her strumming along is as natural as chocolate covered cherries. Mmm ... chocolate.

Please enjoy this record of Kara from the 70s I found at a vintage music store :)

PS Also includes shakers from Stefan Kartenberg.

upload_description_plain:
An ephemeral D-minor drone exploration inspired by a classic rock motif and a riff by Briareus. Just to make things interesting, it is in 7/4 time. The title is an homage to the excellent 2011 book by Sherry Turkle. For more information:

http://sherryturkle.mit.edu/selected-publications

upload_description_plain:
Per Chance, Universe?

or, what did you like to ask again? 

The Secret Mixter:
http://ccmixter.org/thread/4267

The Asignee:
http://ccmixter.org/people/PerchanceMusic/profile

The Sources:
- The Universe Sings http://ccmixter.org/files/PerchanceMusic/61282 
- Verdant Buzz v01 http://ccmixter.org/files/PerchanceMusic/59731
- Verdant Ambience v01 http://ccmixter.org/files/PerchanceMusic/59732
- Tubular Bells from Tritone Progression 001.02 http://ccmixter.org/files/PerchanceMusic/56035

What i did:
- downloaded (per ccmixter client :-) ) PerchanceMusics Uploads 
- threw every flac file found into fl studio
- converted the tubular bells to midi and computed, modified the midi to generate bass lines, chord progression, ... 
- recorded a 3 minute midi drum line via vdrums
- editing, selecting samples and synths, fx
- recorded some percussion, 
- sidechaining, routing and mixdown
- stems and midi export

upload_description_plain:
It is Secret-Mixter-Time again!
We looked at the enormous amount of resources duckett had in store for us then found and cut up some loops which we deemed fit and handy.

A song in E major is what is needed, and yet we wanted to avoid using E as if it carried the plague! What was left was a very sad E major which we liked to deal with.
So we dug deep into our dusty archive of long forgotten and stranded tracks to find an abandoned subject worth to be revived, here it is. A bit shy maybe...

With luv from Hamburg
7OOP3D

upload_description_plain:
Hey all you funky PorchCats and Dogs! :) 

I had the distinct pleasure of remixing the wonderful PorchCat. Admittedly I had not delved much into the back catalog of PorchCat but I'm sure glad I did! The inspiration for the lyric came from an epidemiologist talking about the current global pandemic and describing us as living in the virus' world and not the other way around. We need to stay apart (for a little while longer) and be happy, healthy and wise in how and when we get together physically. Luckily we have placed like this to commune, break digital bread together and celebrate all that we do have! Much love to you all!

Cheers,
Joel.

Lyric:
We Live

In the Virus‚Äô world. The sooner we learn that as a community, as a city, as a world the sooner we will be free. Free to unfurl our sails lift our voices in song and beat our chests in reckless abandon... 
but 
but 
but
we must acknowledge forevermore we - whether we like it or not - Live in the virus‚Äô world.

upload_description_plain:
Nobody left behind!! What a great piece to not leave SK behind with, too, I must say. 

Sharp Tool

You need a sharp tool to put the job right
Something that brightens and turns on the lights
You‚Äôve got that grey thing inside your head
To sort out our work or even get out of bed

You need those quick wits with which we‚Äôre all blessed
Something that helps you to know and not guess
It isn‚Äôt so hard when you think ‚Äòfore you leap
No one gets hurt from thinking too deep

Toys or rockets, ingenuity‚Äôs child
A gift we all have, either acute or mild 
So why‚Äôd you take pride in being so dull
Like evolution‚Äôs misfit lining for the cull

You‚Äôve got that big brain do the job right
Something to cherish, let your thoughts alight
Use the grey matter inside your head
Your friends won‚Äôt mind ignorance shed 

Walking up the side aisle I notice all the colours 
Pointillist artists, cleverly pixellating 
With blue and red dots, a dab of brown here
But you look from afar, and you see it take shape
An image all thought out, right from the start
Just like the song, cleverly crafted from 
rhythms, and neumes, and polyphonic plunks
That get you the win when you mix it all out. 
Yes they get you the win when you mix it out.

upload_description_plain:
I was delighted to be assigned bluemillenium, I love the sound of his tracks and moreover he is one of a select few mixters who always upload all the stems. Listening to his back catalogue I discovered lots of jems (vocals, harmonicas etc.) and settled on the Mon Arbre track for the secret mix. 

This is a substitution remix. I use BM's stems , then substituted the lead synth with guitar, and reinforced the FX stem with acoustic guitar. Earlier versions included Donnie Ozone's magnificent "stranger to ourselves," but this was also swapped out  for a slightly extended vocal. Otherwise just fx and level adjustments.

the vocal is here

upload_description_plain:
(Continuation of The Engineer scifi saga)

So on edge
I hate the sleep now
after so much
they bring no rest
I dream a collage
of memory, hope, and fear
One vista blurring into another

Faces become faces that are not faces
while familiar places
become mockeries of themselves
I run
I run
Fumble and fall
Fumble and fail
I hear them still
echoing in the fringes
their blood my sin
bloodless blood
in the frozen empty

As I stir into waking
I cry in my slumber
pure relief
soon I can work again
face the fixable
fill my hours with bolts and code
with patches and adjustments
and the occasional company
and song

But for decades while we drift
there is nothing but the noise of
dream
tears
fever

But I deserve it
and worse
no matter the logic
no matter the reason

Nobody hates me
more than me when I dream
before opting for short sleeps
was an act of joy
but now
after all this
it is how I hide
from myself
and the
tears
fever
dream

wet preview
dry flac attached

Recorded in 2014 in collaboration with Keytronic who is now publishing as Siobhan Dakay and who has polished the vocals for republishing. 

Lyrics:
UNDER THE CHRISTMAS TREE

Verse
Cold starry nights
A white crescent moon
Sugar and spice
On a long wooden spoon

Verse
Snow flakes and snowballs
Ice skates and sleighs
Mulled wine and mince pies
Fires all ablaze

Verse
Round shining eyes
Pink little cheeks
‚ÄúIs that present mine?‚Äù
But no child must peek

Chorus
Pine cones and candles, snow on the roof
The sound up above of a reindeer hoof
So many parcels, what can they be?
Under the skirts of a glittering tree

Verse
Piles of gifts (sung different)
Christmas bells ring
Lights in the trees
And carols to sing

Verse
Mugs of hot chocolate
A big swirl of cream
Small cold noses
Warmed by the steam

Verse
Millions of toys
On Santa‚Äôs sleigh
Flying round the world
Before Christmas Day

Chorus

Pine cones and candles, snow on the roof
The sound up above of a reindeer hoof
So many parcels, what can they be?
Under the skirts of a glittering tree

Bridge

Hush, hush little children
Run up to your beds
‚ÄúOr you‚Äôll spoil the magic‚Äù
The Christmas Elves said
Wait for the morning
Then open your eyes
Santa has left you a lovely surprise

Final Chorus
Be silent! Listen! Who‚Äôs on the roof?
Donner or Blitzen or Rudolph‚Äôs hoof?
The beautiful angel at the top of the tree
Blows a kiss that only Children can see

upload_description_plain:
I guess I needed to get this out of my system. It's been a long time coming. 

Poison Cup.

We are all experiencing some form of crisis where ever we are on earth. Whether we realise it or not, we are each affected. The effects will leave scars for longer than our lifetimes. The fires are still burning , we all have a story to tell, it burns beyond our ability to focus, whether we realise it or not.
Rise from the ashes.
Revive from ashes and rise. 
 

This life's like a Poison Cup
You take a little sip it's gonna f*5$ you up, oh yea.
People think you're there to please 
All this kissing ass, brings you to your knees. 
Get up, Get up, up, up, yea

We will rise 
We will rise
We Revive from the ashes like a Phoenix 
We will rise, yea, yea, yea 
Rise, Rise.

There is no way to truly explain it in a way that is comprehensible. Whether we realise it or not, hope's winging her way through the desert skies.
Rise from the ashes.
Revive from ashes and rise. 
 

This life is a loaded gun 
You got one in the chamber and you're on the run 
Don't give up, Don't give up,
Face down in a pile of sh*t 
They got the knee on your neck and they're proud of it, Get up,  Get up 

Chorus 

This life is a Poisen Cup 

Chorus 

LS  2020

upload_description_plain:
Whitewolf recently remixed me for  his secret mixter and kindly uploaded some very tasty stems..

He also tried to warn me to stay away from break up songs, so here's a break up song my friend, recycled and repurposed from 10 years ago when I was in a much darker place. 
Love is the ultimate gamble and some time its best to walk away. Def not as warm and optimistic as my most recent love ditties. Balance restored. 
Pell is uploaded here 

"Saint Against the Sinner"

I've never seen you roll
the dice before
collect the prize
then walk away

Under neon lights
the world tastes sweeter
if you're counting cards
till the break of day

With the jackpot won
now you spin the wheel
Am I red or black?
Can you tell whats real?
Now the the games begun
with the cards to deal
I never hear about your losses
just the wins that you feel

You better walk away
if you know what's right
You better find a game
without a price
you betta play it hard 
without a winner
'cause in love you play 
the saint against the sinner

Who's the winner?
Saint against the sinner

You're playing blind man's bluff
the ace is up your sleeve
been trading spades for diamonds girl
deception that you weave
with those nerves of steel
your fingers tap the beat
you betta get out of the kitchen
if you cannot stand the heat

You better walk away
if you know what's right
You better find a way
if you want me tonight
you betta play it hard 
without a winner
cause in love you play 
the saint against the sinner

You better walk away
if you know what's right
You better find a game
where I'm not the prize
you gotta play it hard 
without a winner
cause in love you play 
the saint against the sinner

Who's the winner? 
I'm not the winner

Solo

repeat chorus and fade

Scomber x 2020

upload_description_plain: I have been working on this for a few months now on and off. Decided to finish it and get it uploaded. I like to bounce back and forth between acoustic and electric sounding songs. This would be more on the acoustical spectrum featuring Admiral Bob. His terrific vocals paired so well with the guitars provided by Haskel, I couldn't resist mashing them together on top of drums that I programmed.

upload_description_plain:
"Remember when the music came
From wooden boxes strung with silver wire".
Harry Chapin

To make money from music is truly wonderful but the real wealth is being able to just do it in the first place.

Thanks to The Admiral for the great stems.

I play music....that's what I do
I play it for me I play it for you
You may say I 'm just a fool
But I'll always play the music ...it's what I do

And if the time runs through my hands
Like the shifting of coloured sand
In a bottle that is crammed
With 12 tones of crazy plans

You know me well I've told my truth
It's slightly twisted out of shape but its all I knew
And when the dust has been renewed
I will unpick what's been confused

On salty seas where visions hide
Behind the sail where winds collide
I'll steer the ship and follow tides
Where bludgeoned hopes lay down to die

God bless your ears for taking time
Just to listen to these notes of mine
I'd do it all once more and shine
But the days of song are moving out of line

upload_description_plain:
The year of 2020 is going to be best remembered as the year we would rather forget. 

Let's all drink to the little things we will actually wish to remember, the love and kindness, hope and charity that people around the globe had for the sick and dying, and the overwhelming support for our healthcare workers, doctors and nurses and all of the frontline workers amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

And here's to a better year next year, and hope the vaccine becomes available soon, so we can get on with our lives and deal with the very visible systemic problems that 2020 brought to the forefront.

And here's to Loveshadow, who once again provided a beautifully performed acapella, with wonderful lyrics. 

Cheers!

(Instrumental available, sorry no stems)

110bpm, A

Let’s all drink to the little things we will actually wish to remember, the love and kindness, hope and charity that people around the globe had for the sick and dying, and the overwhelming support for our healthcare workers, doctors and nurses and all of the frontline workers amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

And here’s to a better year next year, and hope the vaccine becomes available soon, so we can get on with our lives and deal with the very visible systemic problems that 2020 brought to the forefront.

And here’s to Loveshadow, who once again provided a beautifully performed acapella, with wonderful lyrics.

Cheers!

upload_description_plain:
There are often two sides to a story but sometimes it is too hard to turn the page.

Thanks to Skye Jordan for the inspiration


I met her at six thirty at the back of a theatre
She was wearing to much makeup for my taste
And her clothes they were suggestive of a life that was directed
To the darker sides which often led to waste

In her hand she had a letter from a lawyer based in Bedford
Who had sort her out to give her some good news
She'd been left a house in Cambridge by a man who was quite famous
He was a customer she often had refused

Oh Rosa Rosa Rosa
How do you look so composed uh
How do you keep your sense of humour amongst the pain
Oh Rosa Rosa Rosa
Is this really what you're after
Its amazing how you never complain

It seems that devils can be angels to those whose life is ending
Always better to be sitting on the fence
Nicer to be kinder  a really good reminder
The Grim Reaper might think this is some defence

When judgement falls upon the weakest shoulders
And books are written without all the facts
The truth is often crushed and battered
And often its too hard to make your own way back

Oh Rosa Rosa

upload_description_plain:
It seems everyone has an opinion on Covid.  Who do we believe.  The government, the scientists, the crazy people?


My grandfather said he'd seen it before
Lots of pestilence and two world wars
People in the streets with spots and sores
And kids with heads full of lice
At the time it was serious they all complained
They thought it would never get better again
But somehow they managed to put up with the pain
And eventually it turned out nice

So gird your loins and be prepared for every expert you ever heard
Everyone has something to say to help old Covid on its way
And the governments of the world agree to move ahead cautiously
There's rhyme and reason on tv its amazing what we believe

Now John told Jane he'd found a cure 
And he would share it with her for sure
But it might involve her removing her draws
She said she'd think it over
So John said he would wait and see
Which way she'd go and if it could be
A permanent cure for the disease
He would sell it to the masses

So gird your loins and be prepared for every expert you ever heard
Everyone has something to say to help old Covid on its way
And the governments of the world agree to move ahead cautiously
There's rhyme and reason on tv its amazing what we believe

Now I'm the sort of man who likes to take a chance on the wild side
Moving forward taking care making sure I am prepared
For all the dangers there are out there, hidden in the open air
Ready to take up the task protected by my paper mask
upload_description_html:
It seems everyone has an opinion on Covid. Who do we believe. The government, the scientists, the crazy people?


My grandfather said he’d seen it before
Lots of pestilence and two world wars
People in the streets with spots and sores
And kids with heads full of lice
At the time it was serious they all complained
They thought it would never get better again
But somehow they managed to put up with the pain
And eventually it turned out nice

So gird your loins and be prepared for every expert you ever heard
Everyone has something to say to help old Covid on its way
And the governments of the world agree to move ahead cautiously
There’s rhyme and reason on tv its amazing what we believe

Now John told Jane he’d found a cure
And he would share it with her for sure
But it might involve her removing her draws
She said she’d think it over
So John said he would wait and see
Which way she’d go and if it could be
A permanent cure for the disease
He would sell it to the masses

So gird your loins and be prepared for every expert you ever heard
Everyone has something to say to help old Covid on its way
And the governments of the world agree to move ahead cautiously
There’s rhyme and reason on tv its amazing what we believe

Now I’m the sort of man who likes to take a chance on the wild side
Moving forward taking care making sure I am prepared
For all the dangers there are out there, hidden in the open air
Ready to take up the task protected by my paper mask

Didn’t get a Secret Mix this time around yet so I made one(hope this is allowed). *UPDATE* Loveshadow threw a massive mix together called Carry Us Home. Check it out here.

This is a sort of Darkroom plays Darkroom. All samples are from my previous songs except the heartfelt spoken word from Kara, who sadly recently lost her father to Covid 19. My thoughts are with you.

Kara - Severed Roots
Darkroom - Tanto Ruido

Darkroom - Sister Funktified

upload_description_plain:
I caught the end of a news item where a distraught woman was explaining to the reporter how her holiday plans were in ruins as a result of a change in Covid restrictions.  The next news item saw an immigrant who had braved the crossing from France to the UK in a small rubber dingy being interviewed.  The reporter asked where he intended to go.  He replied, "To the capitol, yes to the capitol I go."  Alas it was not to the capitol he went but to a detention centre to join the other 4000 who have crossed the seas this year  in boats that barely float to get a taste of our western lives.

Maybe one day he will have the chance to take safer holidays

Many thanks to Javolenus for once more supplying the guitars



I'm a little bit of something from a distant time
From a molecule of dust came this life of mine
Tearing down a vision I began to grow
Everybody's waiting for my faults to show

But I'm tethered and torn like a man in a storm
Starting on a journey to be reborn
Waving to the people who are sitting on the beach
Everybody's crying but it's just relief

So sad so utterly mad 
Risking everything for a new start
On the crest of a wave I arrived today
You can recognise me by my wet clothes

He replied, “To the capitol, yes to the capitol I go.” Alas it was not to the capitol he went but to a detention centre to join the other 4000 who have crossed the seas this year in boats that barely float to get a taste of our western lives.

Maybe one day he will have the chance to take safer holidays

Many thanks to Javolenus for once more supplying the guitars

upload_description_plain:
I have two things on my mind,
one is in the past, the other is in the way;
I'm hearing the same voices as someone else today,
seeing fresh carvings on the wall.

...

I've gone out past the numbers and returned to the line,
but the madness can never leave, it runs in the blood;
I'm hearing the same voices as no one else now.
